questions.question: Decayed plant and animal tissues to fairly amorphous brown to black material are called ---------

explanations.a: Subsoil is the layer below the topsoil, not decayed organic matter.
explanations.b: Regolith refers to loose material covering solid rock, not organic.
explanations.c: Correct. Soil humus is the dark, organic material in soils.
explanations.d: Bedrock is the solid rock beneath soil layers.

explanations.a: Correct. Organic matter contains around 5% nitrogen.
explanations.b: Too high; nitrogen is not present at 70% in organic matter.
explanations.d: Nitrogen is present in soil organic matter.

questions.question: Which of the following element is not present in the soil organic matter.

explanations.a: Correct. All listed elements are present in soil organic matter.
explanations.b: Phosphorus is present in organic matter.
explanations.d: Nitrogen is present in significant amounts.

questions.question: Which of the following is a main significance of soil analysis?

answers.a: It increases the knowledge of what nutrients are especially available in our soil and the efficiency of resource inputs such as fertilisers and water.
answers.b: It increases the environmental impacts due to soil amendments.
answers.c: It doesn't helps to evaluate the fertility status of soils of a country or a state or a district.
answers.d: It doesn't helps to predict the nutritional values needed for crop production.

explanations.a: Correct. This is a major benefit of soil analysis.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Soil analysis reduces environmental impact.
explanations.c: Incorrect. It helps to evaluate soil fertility.
explanations.d: Incorrect. It helps predict nutritional requirements.

questions.question: The term "Organic Soil" is used for ...........

answers.a: Soils with less than 12-18% organic carbon
answers.b: Soils with more than 12-18% organic carbon
answers.c: Soils with more than 20-25% organic carbon
answers.d: Soils with more than 1-10% organic carbon

explanations.a: Too low to classify as organic soil.
explanations.b: Correct. This is the standard threshold.
explanations.c: Higher than typical threshold, but may still apply in specific classifications.
